meanings.definition: To mend or patch (a shoe, for example) with a piece of leather or other material.
meanings.sent1: I had to cobble my shoe with a new piece of leather.
meanings.sent2: The cobbler will cobble the torn shoe sole.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a sight to see him cobble his shoe with a bright pink material.
meanings.sent4: She managed to cobble her shoe together just in time for the party.
meanings.sent5: The old man's skillful hands could cobble any shoe back to life.

meanings.definition: A roughly rounded piece of stone or concrete used in paving streets.
meanings.sent1: The path was made of cobble stones that rattled underfoot.
meanings.sent2: The historic town square was paved with beautiful cobble stones.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids tried to skip the cobble stones like hopscotch.
meanings.sent4: The cobble stones gleamed in the sunlight, creating a picturesque scene.
meanings.sent5: The sound of carriages rolling over the cobble stones echoed through the narrow street.
